title: DOJ Investigating An 'American Problem' In New York, Ferguson And Cleveland
teaser: The Department of Justice is investigating three high-profile cases of fatal shootings of black males by white police officers.
contentencoded:
After the Grand Jury in Staten Island, New York, declined to indict Daniel Pantaleo, the police officer who killed Eric Garner, the U.S. Department of Justice announced it would launch a federal civil rights investigation into the death.

Meanwhile, separate investigations are underway in Ferguson, Missouri, where 18-year-old Michael Brown was fatally shot by a police officer, and Cleveland, Ohio, where 12-year-old Tamir Rice was killed by an officer while carrying a BB gun.

NPR’s Ron Elving talks to Here & Now’s Peter O’Dowd about where those investigations stand and what kind of political reaction each case is getting.

Guest

  • Ron Elving, senior Washington editor and correspondent for NPR. He tweets @relving.
